subject: Re: JUnit bug for XML testing?
msgSnippet: Another idea would be to update the FAQ so that this particular problem could be more readily associated with the FAQ that provides the answer. Right now the
messageBody:
Another idea would be to update the FAQ so that this particular
problem could be more readily associated with the FAQ that provides
the answer.

Right now the title is: "I get a ClassNotFoundException when I use
the LoadingTestRunner".

The title should be: "Why do I am I having problems with Third Party
JAR files (ClassNotFoundException/LinkageError)?" Or something
similar. Neither qingfenglin or myself received a
ClassNotFoundException, we received LinkageError's....

Actually, I don't mean to be a critic, but the documentation for
J/Unit really sucks. I know, I know... if I don't like it I should do
better... Well, I've only been using J/Unit for a couple of days now
so I'm not prepared yet to write docs. As I get more involved with it
I definately plan on putting together a couple of HOWTO's.. until
then, I'd just like to say that the docs are horrible. Great product
(from what I've seen so far), horrible documentation.

Sam W.


--- In junit@y..., Scott Stirling <sstirling@m...> wrote:
> Holy FAQ, Batman! Think we should fix this bug?
>
> If the JUnit maintainers added org.xml.sax.* and org.w3c.dom.* to
the
> default excluded.properties this question would be asked a lot
less, and
> users wouldn't have to point out the FAQ/archives.
>
> Seriously, that's the problem.
>
> Vladimir? Others? Has anyone thought of ways to fix this via
refactoring?
>
> I have one idea:
>
> 1. Make JUnit use a different repository source for its
TestCaseClasLoader,
> much like the way that most app servers allow dynamic reloading of
JSPs and
> Servlets into a custom classloader by _not_ having the custom
classloader
> use the system classpath.
>
> Scott Stirling
> JRun QA
> Macromedia
>
